s.text: Furthermore, says the NYT , early on the morning of the test explosions, "one lonely analyst" saw a photo of fences being removed, but it took four or five hours before more experienced officers arrived to review the evidence.
"Today's Papers" can handle that one--because the more experienced officers have rank, and insist that rank has its privileges, like working during the daytime.

The piece notes that three days before the Indian explosions, a satellite recorded bulldozers appearing near the test site, but that this didn't set off any alarm bells.

An excellently reported piece detailing how the U.S. missed India's nuclear preparations appears on the NYT 's page three.
